page.title: 09Keswick's Pencil Mill
page.content: The Pencil Mill started in 1832.The firm that ran it then was the Greta Pencil Works and Black Lead Mill of Banks and Co in forge Mill.They sell more pencils now than they did in 1832.About 1,500,000 pencils are made a week and 6,000,ooo a month. At the Pencil Mill there are 115 people working.They make 650 different kinds of pencils.The first thing you need to make a pencil is a piece of wood.Californian Cedar is the wood that is mainly used for pencils.The wood is then grooved which means curved dents are made in the wood.Next the leads are placed in the middle. After that another piece of grooved wood is placed on top and glued together.The wood is then shaped into round pencils.Then the pencils are painted,glossed and stamped.
